snippet: At the behest of New York's public pension funds, Goldman Sachs and MetLife have agreed to publicly disclose information about the racial and gender breakdowns of their staffs, Patrick McGeehan reported for The New York Times. On Sunday, Kevin Roose...
abstract: At the behest of New York's public pension funds, Goldman Sachs and MetLife have agreed to publicly disclose information about the racial and gender breakdowns of their staffs, Patrick McGeehan reported for The New York Times. On Sunday, Kevin Roose reported on a growing number of young Muslims on Wall Street.

headline.main: Two Giants of Finance Will Release Diversity Data
